runs.comm: bowls it on a good length on middle, defended with a full face back to the bowler
short of a good length, punched off the back foot to extra cover
gets on the back foot and knocks it down into the off side, Dilshan fields well diving to his right at point

McCullum's gone! That was bowled short and it appeared it came on to hiim quicker than he expected, got into position to pull but mistimed it and Malinga, standing at midwicket, ran a few paces forward, dived and held on to a good low catch
lands on a good length on the off, defended off the front foot to point
short of a good length, gets forward and drops it in front of point
starts poorly though, full on the pads, Ryder flicks him away with ease to the fine-leg boundary
short of a good length outside off, cut way wide of third man for a single, they think of a second but it's not there
rapped on the pads, struck outside the line, nipped back in, there were two sounds but even if it was pad and bat, that could not have bee given
short and too wide, the batsman reaches but can't connect, they get a wide
pitched up and he connects superbly, drilling it hard down the ground past the bowler and mid-on for a boundary
short of a good length, gets on the back foot, drops it into the off side and races through for a single
bowls it on a good length on the off, holds its line, defended to cover
short of a good length on the off, pushed towards extra cover
shortish delivery outside off, slapped off the back foot towards mid-off for a single
powerfully struck, not quite length but he was committed to clearing the ropes there, short of a good length and he shovels it over deep midwicket for a big six
lands on a good length on the off, driven straight to mid-off
slower offcutter, tried to heave it over square leg but it cut away to beat the swing of the bat
slower one again, tries to crack it hard through the off side, misses
short of a good length on middle,punches it to long-on for a single
fullish on the off, turns the face and drives it to long-on
tight line just a fraction outside off, pushed it towards extra cover
dropped, flighted, lands full outside off and he creams it towards extra cover but Dilshan, diving to his right, cannot hold on to a tough chance
the legspinner bowled at 94.5 kmph but down the leg side, he helps it on  its way to the fine-leg boundary
short of a good length on middle, whipped through square leg, Malinga in the deep takes a while to cut that off, they have enough time to come back for the second
beautifully timed, slower one picked straight up, landed on a length outside off and Guptill lofted it elegantly over long-off, effortless shot and it sailed over the ropes
slower one bowled short and cutting in, makes room to dab that past the keeper, can't get his bat to it
did not pick the slower one this time, slips on the pads and he fails to connect, can't sneak a leg bye either
short on the off, makes room and mistimes a pull in front, and slightly wide, of long-on, Ryder calls for the second and makes it back in time with a dive, well done
slower one bowled short outside off, the offcutter, didn't pick it, was into the pull too early, misses
another slow and short one, goes for the pull again ,misses and is struck on the shoulder
the offspinner, lofted it towards long-off, lands on the bounce, cleanly hit

run-out missed, cut towards Malinga at point and Ryder calls for a single, there was no run there but Malinga returned a poor throw to Sangakkara, well wide of the stumps, giving him enough time to complete the single
chipped wide of long-off again for a single
short of a length outside off, makes room and cuts it to point
slower through the air, spinning down leg but just wide of the stumps, had moved to off to pull it behind square, missed, they sneak a bye
pushes it off the front foot wide of extra cover for a single
bowls it full outside leg, sweeps it straight to short fine leg
similar delivery, sweeps it wide of short fine this time for a couple of runs
flighted and he sensed a chance, landed full on the off and he took it on the half-volley to smack it hard over the bowler's head and beat long-on
ooh, short of a length on middle and turning away, tries to cut, misses and Sanga fumbles
turning sharply towards middle and keeps low, strikes the bottom of the bat as he tries to pull, a couple more in front of deep midwicket
short of a length on the off, chops it towards short third man, Guptill calls for a single, Ryder responds late but the throw is to the wrong end
short on leg stump, moves across and paddles it wide of short fine for a single
keeps low, short outside off, slapped wide of long-off for a single, 50-stand comes up
fires it flat outside off, Ryder makes room and strikes it wide of deep cover for a couple of runs
moves well across to paddle it fine, it hits the bottom of the hand and lands in front of the bowler
bowled flat outside off, he's already made room, cracked wide of long-off for another well-run couple
struck well but Welegedara fields well in the deep to keep them down to a single, slog-swept over midwicket and he runs to his left from long-on, slides and saves three runs

clears the ropes, hitting it against the turn, landed on a length outside leg and turns in, bends low and sweeps it high, just good enough to clear deep midwicket, the fielder was standing a few yards inside the ropes

bowled'im! Flat and quick, short on leg and spins sharply towards middle and off, Ryder makes a bit of room and tries to late-cut that behind point, it turns out quicker than he would have liked, misses and the bails are taken out
gets across to that tossed up delivery and works it behind square for a single
turning in, pushes it past the bowler to long-on for a single
turns the face, keeps a little low that one, turned through square leg for one more
length ball, pushed to the right of the bowler
keeps it tidy, defended to short cover
quicker ball does the job for Jayasuriya, a 96 kmh yorker is too good for Guptill, he's too late on the shot and is bowled, Sri Lanka are clawing their way back into this, middle stump knocked out
length ball outside off, driven along the ground to long-off for a single to end the over
lands on a good length outside off, pushed towards midwicket
turns the face to play it towards short fine for a quick single
moves well across and nudges it wide of Jayasuriya at short fine, he dives and keeps them to just a single
tossed up outside off, tapped wide of cover for a single
that went on straight, got across and defended it towards extra cover
plays it with soft hands in front of point for a quick single
targeting middle, defended back to the bowler
pushed towards backward point for a single
driven down towards long-on for a single
nudges it in front of extra cover to steal one more
shortish outside off, cut wide of Malinga at point for one more
gave him a bit of a charge but that wasn't at the right length, defended to extra cover
tossed up outside off, driven wide of long-on for a couple of runs
the legspinner which he didn't pick, turned away from a good length and beat the outside edge as he played inside the line to that one
gets an outside edge, made room to drive him, got a thick edge to point, no single on offer there, the pressure builds
held back the length, short on the off, punched to extra cover
some relief for New Zealand, short and he latched onto it, rocking back and pulling him between deep square leg and deep midwicket
short of a length outside off, slaps it straight towards extra cover
gets front and across, turns it wide of midwicket for a quick single, a direct hit at the bowler's end would have made things interesting
driven down the ground to long-on
played straight towards extra cover
slightly short, drops it in front of point for a single
fires a full delivery on middle, makes room and drives hard but straight to extra cover
keeps low, knocks it in front of extra cover for a single
dropped, short on the off, slow through the air, smacked hard to Jayawardene at extra cover and he can't hold on to a sharp one to his right

No lapses this time, Ross Taylor goes, he pulls out his trademark slog-sweep but doesn't connect well, gets plenty of elevation and Angelo Mathews does well to clasp a tough catch with the sun in his eyes near deep midwicket
pushed straight to midwicket
the doosra, got forward and defended it to extra cover
beaten, closed the face on it but it zipped away from a good length to beat the outside edge
flighted on middle, swept towards deep square leg for a single
bowls it on a good length outside off, Vettori moves well across, flicks it to midwicket, and gets a single
slower offcutter, taps it wide of midwicket for a single

run-out appeal, moved across and worked that full and slower delivery behind square, rushes back for the second, it's a good throw to Sangakkara who flips it back onto the stumps but Vettori's dive has just managed to save him
full outside off, steered down to third man for a single
slower one, pulls him awkwardly to fine leg, short delivery, he was intending to hit that squarer
full outside off, slices it towards deep point for a single to keep strike
comes down the track and almost yorks himself, dabs it into the off side for a single
bowled'im! Could that be the decisive blow? Short of a good length, that held its line, Styris made room and tried to smash that over midwicket, missed and heard the death rattle
quicker through the air, works it away behind square for a single, Oram slips at the non-striker's end, no chance of a second
Vettori comes down the track, Mendis holds back his length, chips it towards extra cover for a single
that's disappeared! Bowled it on a good length, Oram came down the track and launched it over long-on for a massive sixes

Six more! Flighted and he had made up his mind, came down the track, got to the pitch and lofted it high with one hand, it seemed as though Welegedara at long-on had it well covered but it just about managed to clear him in the end, the wind may have taken it over
What is Sangakkara appealing for? Full outside off, he tries to steer that past point, the ball bounces after it misses the bat and gets to Sanga who goes up
driven to long-off for a single

fullish outside off, tries to drop it into the off side, gets an inside edge, Vettori calls for a single, Oram responds late, but manages the single, blocking Malinga's view as he tries to aim at the non-striker's end
squeezes it behind square on the off side, completes the single and calls for the second, a throw to the non-striker;s end, Malinga flips it onto the stumps but Oram has made it in time
low full toss on the off, drilled down to long-off for a single
yorker outside off, Oram makes room, digs it into the off side and gets the single he needs to be on strike
Timber! Full and straight, Oram takes his right foot out and tries to swing it over wide long-on, misses and the stumps take a beating

run-out, full outside off, slices it behind point, Dilshan runs to his left from deep point and returns a powerful throw back to Sangakkara who collects on the half-volley and takes off the stumps to find Hopkins well short as he tries to make it back for the second, New Zealand are sliding now
pushed it full on the off, driven to long-off for a single
finds the gap, was bowled full, moved across and swiped it between deep square leg and deep midwicket for a boundary
yorker on leg stump, digs it out into the leg side behind square for a single

missed run-out, low full toss on middle, gets across and chips it over midwicket, they steal two and McCullum attempts an unlikely third, the throw lands on the bounce to Welegedara who fails to collect and McCullum's dive saves him
yorker on middle, all he can do is play it to mid-on for a single

missed run-out, full outside off,. Vettori tries to steer and misses, Sangakkara sends the ball back to Malinga as McCullum wants the bye, he has all the time to run to the stumps and take off the bails but he misses an under-arm flick onto the stumps, allowing them a chance to steal the run they wanted
found the gap, full delivery and he moved across and swing that between fine leg and deep square leg, perfect placement, had found his spot and executed the shot brilliantly
run-out, aiming for the blockhole, driven to long-on, Vettori tries an improbable second run and Malinga this time collects well and takes off the bails, eight down

Six, Six, Six! What a blow, Nathan McCullum's handed New Zealand a thrilling win, lands on a length outside off, just perfect for McCullum who strikes it powerfully and cleanly over the long-off boundary to seal victory for New Zealand
